text_sections.section_2: „Me or us? The fight for a sustainable future“
text_sections.section_3: In a world grappling with pressing environmental, social and economic challenges, a vital question emerges: How can we reconcile individual and collective interests to create a sustainable future? This thought-provoking series of events explores this tension and invites participants to consider the balance between self and community, individual responsibility and solidarity, competition and cooperation.
text_sections.section_4: Through compelling presentations by experts from a range of disciplines, we’ll address fundamental questions about morality, responsibility and sustainable behaviour. From philosophical insights and economic theories to literary reflections and practical solutions, the series offers a rich, interdisciplinary understanding of the dynamics between individual and collective action.
text_sections.section_6: is an annual lecture series organised by the Technical University of Nuremberg. It encourages young people to examine their role in society, discover new perspectives and engage with the pressing challenges of our time. The series provides a platform for exploring solutions to critical issues such as climate change, social justice, education and technological innovation.
text_sections.section_7: A key focus is on empowering participants to actively contribute to shaping a better world. The series also highlights the innovative and interdisciplinary approach to education at TU Nuremberg. Participants can exchange ideas with experts, explore cutting-edge concepts and gain valuable insights into the challenges and opportunities of our shared future.
text_sections.section_9: The lectures are all in German except for Ermelinda Kanushi’s lecture. Here you can find the PDFs of the presentations (https://faubox.rrze.uni-erlangen.de/getlink/fi72xvazapdSbbH3Tvow9v/Junior-Studium%40UTN%202025) of the past events.
text_sections.section_11: You may register for the entire series or individual events. Please include the exact number of participants in your email.
